a.span:
April 24, 2020
Dear MISD Families, I hope this n

img.alt:
April 24, 2020
Dear MISD Families, I hope this note finds you and your family safe and healthy. Last week’s decision regarding school closure for the remainder of the school year was a very sad announcement for us to hear and to share with families. As educators, our MISD staff truly love our students, so we continue to work through the sadness and disappointment of the closure. If your child is struggling, please feel free to reach out to the building administrator, teacher/advisor, or school counselor for support. The social-emotional and health needs for our students, families, and staff continue to be at the forefront of our decision making. Although we will not likely have all the answers you are seeking, we are here to help in navigating the challenges you may be facing. We also understand there are many questions regarding next steps for your child. We continue to work to answer these, but also will remain conscientious of the health and safety for all involved as we make decisions. Listed below, please note the most recent updates. Grade promotion for PK-8: All students PK-8 will move on to the next grade level for the 2020-21 school year. Students will receive an end-of year report card or progress report that will be based on all learning prior to the closure. All students in grades PK-8 will continue to be provided with learning enrichment opportunities through the remainder of the 2019-20 school year, with a scheduled last day of June 3, 2020. Teachers will continue to reach out to provide support for your child as we seek to find the right fit for your family’s current circumstances and ability to engage in learning amidst the other challenges you may be facing. We recognize that there will be some gaps in learning. We will be working as a staff yet this year in how we will ensure the essential content missed this year will be covered in the upcoming year. Picking up personal belongings: From now until at least May 1 we will not be adding any access to the school buildings, which aligns to the Governor’s guidance for our county to limit interaction for essential workers or essential tasks only. After May 1 we will reevaluate

span.a: Welcome to the new Marion Digital Backpack

div.p: Here you can find information on upcoming events, activities and opportunities.

p.span:
April 24, 2020
Dear MISD Families,
I hope this note finds you and your family safe and healthy. Last week’s decision regarding school closure for the remainder of the school year was a very sad announcement for us to hear and to share with families. As educators, our MISD staff truly love our students, so we continue to work through the sadness and disappointment of the closure. If your child is struggling, please feel free to reach out to the building administrator, teacher/advisor, or school counselor for support. The social-emotional and health needs for our students, families, and staff continue to be at the forefront of our decision making. Although we will not likely have all the answers you are seeking, we are here to help in navigating the challenges you may be facing.
We also understand there are many questions regarding next steps for your child. We continue to work to answer these, but also will remain conscientious of the health and safety for all involved as we make decisions. Listed below, please note the most recent updates.
Grade promotion for PK-8: All students PK-8 will move on to the next grade level for the 2020-21 school year. Students will receive an end-of year report card or progress report that will be based on all learning prior to the closure. All students in grades PK-8 will continue to be provided with learning enrichment opportunities through the remainder of the 2019-20 school year, with a scheduled last day of June 3, 2020. Teachers will continue to reach out to provide support for your child as we seek to find the right fit for your family’s current circumstances and ability to engage in learning amidst the other challenges you may be facing. We recognize that there will be some gaps in learning. We will be working as a staff yet this year in how we will ensure the essential content missed this year will be covered in the upcoming year.
Picking up personal belongings: From now until at least May 1 we will not be adding any access to the school buildings, which aligns to the Governor’s guidance for our county to limit interaction for essential workers or essential tasks only. After May 1 we will reevaluate based on any updated recommendations for social distancing and group size. Our tentative plan is to have staff, when deemed safe to do so, empty desks/lockers and bag student materials to be picked up at a scheduled date/time. If there are emergency needs that cannot wait until this scheduled pick up, please contact the building principal to arrange an alternative.
Prom, Honors Night, and Graduation: At MISD, we recognize that high school is not only about the learning opportunities, but it is also about the experiences. Although we would love nothing more than to be able to provide these experiences for our students in the same manner as in the past, the current guidance concerning safety and staying at home do not allow for that. Given the current guidance, we have not yet made final determinations about prom for this year. With regard to Honors Night, we will hold a virtual or video ceremony with finalized details coming in the next few weeks. Lastly, with regard to graduation, we will be developing a video ceremony to be released at the regularly scheduled date and time. In addition, if we are able to safely do so, we will host a modified ceremony in June or July for students and families. Over the next few weeks Mr. Semler will be sharing additional information regarding these events. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we consider decisions in this difficult situation.
As has been previously noted, for additional questions please see below for contact information:
*Building principal for general questions regarding Educational Enrichment (PK-8) or Required Online Learning (9-12)
*Classroom or mentor teacher for specific questions regarding the instructional resources to support your child
*School counselor for additional support in talking with your children about COVID-19
*Gretchen Kriegel, Assistant Superintendent, for Instructional or Special Education questions
*Christie VanWey, Business Manager, regarding school breakfast/lunch
*Janelle Brouwer, Superintendent, for any remaining questions or concerns
We continue to look forward to the day we will reopen our doors to celebrate face-to-face learning opportunities with students again! Thank you for being a part of our MISD family!
Respectfully,
Janelle Brouwer, Superintendent

We would appreciate your count! For the first time, in 2020 the U.S. Census Bureau will accept responses online. The process will be quick and secure. You can respond to the census in less time than it takes to finish your morning coffee. You’ll still be able to respond by mail. To learn more about what to expect, visit 2020census.gov. #2020Census #MISDOwnYourFuture
Project Graduation T-Shirt Orders for Seniors 2020 - www.iowasignshop.com/marion

April 17, 2020
Dear MISD Families,
During her daily press conference today, Governor Reynolds announced that Iowa schools will be closed for the remainder of the school year, to include all spring sports. She also announced that a decision regarding summer sports seasons would be made by June 1, 2020. This means all MISD indoor and outdoor facilities remain closed.
MISD will provide continuous learning for your children through the remainder of the school year. Our PK-8 teachers will continue to provide Voluntary Educational Enrichment Opportunities, which we strongly encourage students and families to engage in to the extent possible. For 9-12 students, Required Online Learning will begin as scheduled on Monday, April 20.
For the Class of 2020, we recognize this is not the senior year you had anticipated. We will be making decisions in the upcoming week with regard to prom and graduation. We have been considering a variety of possible options as we awaited the Governor’s decision today. Please know that you are in our thoughts as we consider how to best honor your accomplishments in a safe manner.
Grab and Go meals will also continue through the end of the school year, and can be picked up at Vernon MS from 6:30-8:30 AM and 10-12:00 PM on Mondays and Thursdays. Meals are available for all students 18 years and younger.
For additional questions please see below for contact information:
*Building principal for general questions regarding Educational Enrichment (PK-8) or Required Online Learning (9-12)
*Classroom or mentor teacher for specific questions regarding the instructional resources to support your child
*School counselor for additional support in talking with your children about COVID-19
*Gretchen Kriegel, Assistant Superintendent, for Instructional or Special Education questions
*Christie VanWey, Business Manager, regarding school breakfast/lunch
*Janelle Brouwer, Superintendent, for any remaining questions or concerns
We continue to keep each student and family in our thoughts and look forward to the day we are able to meet face to face again.
Respectfully,
Janelle Brouwer, Superintendent
Tanager is offering a Virtual High School Support Group. More details can be found at: drive.google.com/file/d/1xEpPB-_1mgoQLcnIl5OPPZwhtloEWj1D/view?usp=sharing
